hard_rules.description: Provider must possess current, active, and unrestricted medical license in state(s) of practice
License must be in good standing with no pending disciplinary actions
No license suspensions, revocations, or restrictions within past 10 years
License expiration date must be at least 90 days from application date
Current and valid DEA registration for providers prescribing controlled substances
No DEA sanctions or restrictions within past 5 years
Board certification in primary specialty from ABMS-recognized board
Certification must be current and not expired
Graduation from LCME-accredited medical school or IMED-listed with ECFMG certification
Completion of ACGME-accredited residency program in primary specialty
Active staff privileges at JCAHO-accredited hospital or ambulatory surgery center
Privileges must be unrestricted and in good standing
Current professional liability insurance meeting minimum coverage limits by specialty
Insurance carrier must be rated A.M. Best A- or better
Complete malpractice claims history for past 10 years with review of significant settlements
FBI criminal background check within past 12 months with no disqualifying convictions
No exclusions from Medicare, Medicaid, or federal programs per OIG database
Chronological work history for past 5 years with no unexplained gaps >30 days
Minimum 3 professional references from healthcare colleagues with direct working relationship
Current physical examination within past 12 months with no impairments affecting patient care
Current immunizations per CDC healthcare worker recommendations including COVID-19
Current OSHA bloodborne pathogens and healthcare worker safety training
Current CPR/BLS certification appropriate for healthcare providers
HIPAA privacy and security training completion with signed confidentiality agreement
Current CME requirements met for license maintenance and specialty board

soft_rules.description: Fellowship training in subspecialty areas demonstrates advanced expertise
Additional board certifications in related specialties
Published research in peer-reviewed medical journals
Academic appointment at medical school or teaching hospital
Active membership in relevant professional medical societies
Leadership positions in medical organizations or committees
Advanced proficiency with electronic health record systems
Experience with telemedicine platforms and virtual care delivery
Above-average patient satisfaction scores and ratings
Superior clinical outcome metrics and low complication rates
Fluency in languages other than English to serve diverse populations
Specialized training in cultural competency and health equity
Experience teaching medical students, residents, or other healthcare professionals
Practice location in medically underserved areas or rural communities
Availability for extended hours, weekends, or after-hours care
Leadership or active participation in quality improvement initiatives
Volunteer medical services and community health involvement
Demonstrated financial stability and appropriate practice management
Practice in medical specialties with high network demand
Implementation of innovative digital health technologies

surgical_specialties.description: Minimum annual case volumes for specific surgical procedures
Surgical outcome data and complication rates within acceptable ranges

mental_health.description: Current state psychology or clinical social work license
Substance abuse treatment certification if providing addiction services

emergency_medicine.description: ABEM or AOBEM board certification in emergency medicine
Advanced Trauma Life Support certification current

ongoing_verification.description: Quarterly verification of license status and standing
Annual verification of malpractice insurance coverage

recredentialing.description: Complete recredentialing process every three years
